text: Riverside landscape with a castle in the distance, 1793 Amelia Hotham (c 1776 – 1812) was a British watercolour painter. She was the daughter of Susannah Hankey and Beaumont, 2nd Lord Hotham. She married John Woodcock in 1798.Amelia Hotham on The Peerage (genealogical survey of the peerage of Britain) website The painter George Hotham (1796–1860) was her younger cousin. Her watercolour painting Riverside landscape with a castle in the distance, dated 1793, was included in the 1905 book Women Painters of the World.Women painters of the world, from the time of Caterina Vigri, 1413-1463, to Rosa Bonheur and the present day, by Walter Shaw Sparrow, The Art and Life Library, Hodder & Stoughton, 27 Paternoster Row, London, 1905 ==References== Category:1770s births Category:1812 deaths Category:British painters Category:British women painters
title: Amelia Hotham
